basics.name: Balazs Lajtha
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Builder, teacher, lifelong learner. User- and product-focused engineer with an agile mindset and an affinity for clean code. Senior backend engineer experienced in designing flexible and scalable systems, with a proven track record of improving processes and products in organizations of all sizes and maturity levels.

work.name: Coursera
work.summary: Senior backend engineer on the Degrees and Mobile teams. On the Degrees team, led cleanup and modernization of the stackability feature spanning multiple services and teams: designed a single source of truth, implemented a new backend service with GraphQL APIs, migrated data, streamlined pipelines, and created internal documentation and tooling for data access. On the Mobile team, improved backend service availability and implemented GraphQL for the Mobile Backend For Frontend.

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: Backend engineer on the Amazon Flex DEMS team, designing and implementing services to evaluate driver performance and eligibility for incentives. Developed scalable backend pipelines processing high-volume delivery events, ensuring data integrity. Contributed to the launch of Rewards and Achievements features in the Flex driver application, improving driver engagement and incentive tracking.

work.name: Self employed
work.summary: Consulted for Webshippy during its transition from a single-developer product to an agile multi-engineer team. Defined development processes and quality standards to support scalable growth. Mentored engineers in Scrum, TDD, Clean Code, and software architecture, fostering team autonomy and technical excellence.

work.name: TOPdesk
work.summary: Full-stack engineer on the Asset Management module, designing and implementing the backend service, REST APIs, frontend features, and automated tests. Participated in product discovery through customer interviews, story mapping, and functional design, influencing both technical and product decisions. Contributed to scalable, maintainable systems while improving development processes and code quality.

work.name: Prezi
work.summary: Software engineer on the Prezi Desktop team, improving code quality through refactoring and implementing automated tests. Created the installer, and updated the application to support offline mode.

work.name: BME TMIT
work.summary: Software engineer at department of Telecommunications and Media Informatics, designing and implementing research and innovation projects including simulations, prototypes, and educational tools. Led software laboratory courses, developed curricula, and supervised individual and team-based student projects. Applied a wide range of technologies, fostering hands-on learning and practical software engineering skills.

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Developed TTCN-3 automated test suites for IMS systems and routing protocols, enhancing system reliability and accelerating safe software delivery.

work.name: Ericsson Hungary Research & Development
work.summary: Designed and implemented Excel- and Web-based dashboards for monitoring telecommunication services. Built data visualization tools to analyze network traffic, user behavior, and system performance, providing operational insights for diagnostics and supporting decision-making.
